meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Norway and Denmark.
meanings.sent1: In Norway, you can buy a lot with just a few kronen.
meanings.sent2: She exchanged her euros for kronen before traveling to Denmark.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her toy coins were kronen for her make-believe store.
meanings.sent4: The golden kronen shone brightly in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the kronen dropping into the donation box echoed through the church.

meanings.definition: To crown or encircle with a wreath or garland.
meanings.sent1: The winner of the race was kronen with a laurel wreath.
meanings.sent2: They decided to kronen the statue in the park with flowers for the festival.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully tried to kronen the cake with spaghetti instead of the usual frosting.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun seemed to kronen the mountain peaks with a golden glow.
meanings.sent5: The magician used his wand to kronen the volunteer's head with a ring of colorful scarves.

meanings.definition: A former monetary unit of Austria and Germany.
meanings.sent1: Collectors enjoy finding old kronen coins from Austria.
meanings.sent2: Before the euro, people used kronen for transactions in Germany.
meanings.sent3: The antique shop owner proudly displayed a collection of old kronen notes.
meanings.sent4: The history museum had a special exhibit showcasing the evolution of the Austrian kronen.
meanings.sent5: The value of the vintage kronen banknotes has increased over the years.
